CatDescriptText: Barbara Gray, Coraopolis, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 17, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe that city patrolmen and firemen should be required to work more than 40 hours per week?" Answer reads: "If an emergency arises yes. But they should receive overtime pay the same as men in mills are paid for overtime."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Barbara Gray wearing light colored coat and light colored blouse with lace trim, standing in front of store window, Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
